title: Words in Context Essentials
learning_objectives: Understand how context determines word meaning
Apply the 5-step strategy for solving Words in Context questions

content.title: Words in Context Essentials
content.subtitle: Understanding meaning, tone, and structure in context
points: Understanding how surrounding text determines the best word choice
Working with words that have multiple meanings

content.title: Common Challenges
content.explanation: Words may have multiple meanings; only one fits the passage context.
content.example: The word 'fine' could mean good quality, thin, or a penalty - context determines the right meaning!

content.title: 5-Step Approach
steps: Step 1: Context Analysis - Read the sentence and understand the blank's role
Step 2: Bridge Word - Look for signal words that show relationships
Step 3: Word Cluster - Predict the type of word needed
Step 4: Process of Elimination - Rule out obviously wrong choices
Step 5: Verification - Test your choice by reading the complete sentence

content.title: Apply the Strategy
content.question: The scientist's approach was less _______ than others.
content.explanation: The word 'derivative' means unoriginal or copied from others. The phrase 'less than others' indicates we need a word that shows the scientist's approach lacked something compared to others. 'Less derivative' would mean more original, which fits the context.

content.title: Solution Walkthrough
solution_steps: Context shows 'less _____ than others' - comparison structure
Predict: something that others have more of, scientist has less of
Test 'derivative': means unoriginal - fits perfectly with 'less than others'
Verify: 'The scientist's approach was less derivative than others' makes sense

content.title: Key Takeaways
content.summary: You've mastered the fundamentals of Words in Context!
key_points: Always test your choice in the sentence context
Look for signal words that show relationships
content.next_steps: Ready to practice with more Words in Context questions!
